intro: Hedyotis pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf strobilanthes, is a small herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features opposite, linear leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers clustered in cymes. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest undergrowth. Hedyotis pygmaea is valued in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
